com.embeddedunveiled.serial.usb

Class SerialComUSBPowerInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.embeddedunveiled.serial.usb.SerialComUSBPowerInfo

  • public final class SerialComUSBPowerInfo
extends java.lang.Object

    Encapsulates various power related information about a USB device.

    Author:
    Rishi Gupta

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SerialComUSBPowerInfo(java.lang.String autoSuspendDelay, java.lang.String currentControlConfig, java.lang.String currentRuntimeStatus, java.lang.String isSelectiveSuspendSupported, java.lang.String isSelectiveSuspendEnabled, java.lang.String selectiveSuspendTimeoutValue)
      Construct and allocates a new SerialComUSBPowerInfo object with the given details.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void dumpDevicePowerInfo()
      Prints information about power management of this USB device on console.
      java.lang.String getAutoSuspendDelay()
      Retrieves time after which this USB device will be allowed to auto suspend if idle.
      java.lang.String getCurrentControlConfig()
      Retrieves value indicating whether this USB device will be prevented from auto suspending or is allowed to auto suspend.
      java.lang.String getCurrentRuntimeStatus()
      Retrieves value indicating whether this USB device is active or auto suspended.
      int getSelectiveSuspendTimeout()
      Gives current selective suspend timeout value for this device.
      java.lang.Boolean isSelectiveSuspendEnabled()
      Tells whether selective suspend is enabled or not.
      java.lang.Boolean isSelectiveSuspendSupported()
      Tells whether device support selective suspend or not.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SerialComUSBPowerInfo

        public SerialComUSBPowerInfo(java.lang.String autoSuspendDelay,
                     java.lang.String currentControlConfig,
                     java.lang.String currentRuntimeStatus,
                     java.lang.String isSelectiveSuspendSupported,
                     java.lang.String isSelectiveSuspendEnabled,
                     java.lang.String selectiveSuspendTimeoutValue)

        Construct and allocates a new SerialComUSBPowerInfo object with the given details.

        Parameters:
        autoSuspendDelay - delay in milliseconds before USB device is suspended after inactivity.
        currentControlConfig - value indicating whether device is to be kept on always or is allowed to suspend.
        currentRuntimeStatus - current power status (on or suspended) of this USB device.
        isSelectiveSuspendSupported - string indicating window's selective suspend supported or not.
        isSelectiveSuspendEnabled - string indicating window's selective suspend is enabled or not.
        selectiveSuspendTimeoutValue - string indicating window's selective suspend timeout value.

    • Method Detail

      • getAutoSuspendDelay

        public java.lang.String getAutoSuspendDelay()

        Retrieves time after which this USB device will be allowed to auto suspend if idle.

        Returns:
        time in milliseconds as string.

      • getCurrentControlConfig

        public java.lang.String getCurrentControlConfig()

        Retrieves value indicating whether this USB device will be prevented from auto suspending or is allowed to auto suspend.

        Returns:
        current control setting string.

      • getCurrentRuntimeStatus

        public java.lang.String getCurrentRuntimeStatus()

        Retrieves value indicating whether this USB device is active or auto suspended.

        Returns:
        current power status string.

      • isSelectiveSuspendSupported

        public java.lang.Boolean isSelectiveSuspendSupported()

        Tells whether device support selective suspend or not.

        Returns:
        true if selective suspend supported otherwise false.

      • isSelectiveSuspendEnabled

        public java.lang.Boolean isSelectiveSuspendEnabled()

        Tells whether selective suspend is enabled or not.

        Returns:
        true if selective suspend is enabled otherwise false.

      • getSelectiveSuspendTimeout

        public int getSelectiveSuspendTimeout()

        Gives current selective suspend timeout value for this device.

        Returns:
        timeout value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the timeout value hex string can not be converted into numerical representation.

      • dumpDevicePowerInfo

        public void dumpDevicePowerInfo()

        Prints information about power management of this USB device on console.
